title: TreeExplainer.shap_values() incorrect results for model with output vector

labels.name: todo
labels.description: This issue had an outstanding action to take.

body:
I am using a scikit-learn RandomForestClassifier as follows:

`model = RandomForestClassifier(**parameters)`
`model.fit(X, y)`

`explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model)`
`shap_values = explainer.shap_values(X)`

`y` is Nx2, with each element of the output 2-vector having two possible classes (0 or 1).

My plots look like the following:
`shap.summary_plot(shap_values, X, plot_type='bar')`

![Unknown-3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10029985/55493263-a46e5f00-5606-11e9-8524-31c42858458f.png)



Note that the bars are all divided exactly equally into the two classes. It looks like shap_values[0] and shap_values[1] represent the 0 or 1 classes for only the first component of the output vector rather than the importance for the two components of the vector.


`shap.summary_plot(shap_values[0], X, plot_type='layered_violin')`
![Unknown-1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10029985/55492365-16de3f80-5605-11e9-9990-8732aaead8d7.png)

Compare with the next figure...

`shap.summary_plot(shap_values[1], X, plot_type='layered_violin')`
![Unknown-2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10029985/55492402-23fb2e80-5605-11e9-94e5-ab7fed189db8.png)

This is the exact mirror image of the preceding figure. Again, it looks like shap_values[0] and shap_values[1] represent only one component of the output vector. How do I get the other one?
